IRM 3.17.221 dated November 20, 2015 (effective January 1, 2016) is superseded. This IRM also incorporates the following IRM procedural updates (IPU’s) issued from April 7, 2017 thru April 20, 2017 - 17U0652 and 17U0717.
This IRM provides instructions for use by the Enterprise Computing Center (ECC) Data Controls function.
Center Data Controls

) Purpose: These instructions are provided for use by the Enterprise Center (ECC) Unisys and IBM Master File in the Operations Services, uling and Validation Branch (OSSVB) for the purpose of balancing, reconciliation, and control of accounting data. Note: IRM deviations must be submitted in writing following instructions from
, Internal Management Documents System - Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) Process, IRM Standards, and elevated through appropriate channels for executive approval. (
) Audience: ECC Unisys and IBM Master File in the Operations Services, Scheduling and Validation Branch. (
) Policy Owner: The Director of Enterprise Computing Center. (
) Program Owner: Enterprise Automated Deployment, Systems Control Section. (

) This IRM includes instructions for: a. Balancing of ECC weekly Master File processing b. Balancing of ECC daily and weekly and Individual Master File (IMF) cessing c. Balancing of ﬁles received from the Submission Processing Campuses, Bureau of Fiscal Services, Regional Financial Centers and internal pro- cessing d. Preparing and balancing the Reciprocal Accounting Control Report (RACR) if manual intervention is necessary e. Reconciliation of the Master File - prepare Data Adjustment Vouchers if necessary f. Balancing of Revenue Receipts received from the Submission Campuses g. Control of refund data released to Bureau of Fiscal Services (BFS) (

) Enterprise Computing Center (ECC) control and accountability begins with acceptance of ECC-Memphis (ECC-MEM) and ECC-Martinsburg Master File data. ) The Master File Support (MFS) function Computer System Analysts and Resident Programmer Analysts (RPAs) is responsible for ensuring totals of records and/or prejournalized debits and credits are balanced to outputs before the initiation of succeeding runs (run-to-run, abends, due to imbalances, programming issues). Also, required balancing of data be complete and correct before the release of ﬁles to the Submission ing Campuses or Kansas City Financial Center (

) Reconciliation using Data Adjustment Vouchers (DAV) to request to the reciprocal controls between ECC and the various campuses is the sponsibility of the Processing Validation function. MFS will open a KISAM to document all processing discrepancies. (

) Automated Data Processing (ADP) Output Controls - Automated balancing routines containing equations to compile data from various locations, Log Analysis and Reporting System (LARS) controls to summarize an output control for quick reference by PVS; replaces manual compilation of output controls in IBM production. (
) CADE
- Scheduled Schematic to Processing Time Frames Mapping - This spreadsheet is saved on the Service operation Command Center (SOCC) Shar

oint and lists all critical jobs that are processed daily and weekly. This report shows the IMF run schematic time frame, where we are in processing, and if any tickets are opened on the jobs, etc. PVS uses this tool to show if IMF cycle has good completion, what jobs are still waiting to process, what jobs are bad and any tickets that are open. This information is utilized to identify current status and to determine if any downstream processes are impacted. Each IBM Master File group has access to update their part of the spreadsheet; PVS updates refund certiﬁcation, turning it green for all good, to indicate issue resulting in refunds being suspended.

) C - List - Created under an option in LARS. Contains the audit trail of run-to-run balancing of processing in IBM production environment. (

) DOC IT - Secured web-based application that stores computer operator handbooks and schematics, database is updated by national office mers. PVS uses this tool to validate that the jobs are being processed and in the correct ﬂow, and no ﬁles have been left out of the job stream. (

) ENDEVOR - Automated Conﬁguration Management Tool - IBM. Use of the ENDEVOR tool ensures that controlled production libraries contain the version and level, of all existing IRS IBM application source code. facilitates easy access to the official level of source code as a starting point development activity, signiﬁcantly reduces the effort required to transmit software to production sites after development and testing, and ensures modiﬁed source elements do not move into production libraries until the priate time. (

) Intershift Report - Report created by IBM Automation Section and by Master File Scheduling. This report resides on the IBM mainframe. This report provides a synopsis of Master File processing activities. It provides a status of all jobs out on the active job list, what jobs have ran, what the jobs are waiting for to run, and if any KISAM tickets opened, the associated with that run. Report is updated at the end of each scheduling daily. (

) Processing Notes - Updated and maintained by IBM Scheduling Section based on information and directions provided by the programmers for lishing the daily/weekly processing schedules. This information is located the ECC website under system support. PVS uses these notes to verify listed in the Production Log (PLOG) on the mainframe were input for that cycle. Information in the processing notes will indicate if there are ENDEVOR memos for the cycle that may have transmitted a new Job Language (JCL) for processing the job; PVS veriﬁes the correct JCL was based on the memo. (
) Resource Access Control Facility (RACF) / IBM Mainframe - A Software Security Package leased from IBM and is installed on the IBM-compatible Master File computers. (
) This section relates to administrative rules. (
) The Budget and Accounting Procedures Act of

, and amendments places the responsibility for establishing and maintaining adequate systems accounting and internal control upon the head of each executive agency. These systems must conform to the accounting principles, standards, and related requirements prescribed by the Comptroller General of the United States. These are reﬂected in the “General Accountability Office Policy and Procedures Manual for Guidance of Federal Agencies.” Section
of that Internal Revenue Manual

The Budget and Accounting Procedures Act of

, and amendments thereto, places the responsibility for establishing and maintaining adequate systems of accounting and internal control upon the head of each executive agency. These systems must conform to the accounting principles, standards, and related requirements prescribed by the Comptroller General of the United States. These are reﬂected in the “General Accountability Office Policy and Procedures Manual for Guidance of Federal Agencies.” Section
of that act
3.17 Accounting and Data Control
states that the head of each executive agency shall establish and maintain systems of accounting and internal control to provide:

systems of accounting and internal control to provide: a. Full disclosure of the ﬁnancial activities of the agency b. Adequate ﬁnancial information needed for management purposes of the agency c. Effective control over and accountability for all funds, property, and other assets for which the agency is responsible, including appropriate audit d. Reliable accounting results to serve as the basis for preparation and support of budget requests for controlling the execution of its budget, for providing ﬁnancial information required by the Office of Management and Budget e. Suitable integration of the accounting of the agency with the accounting the Treasury Department in connection with the central accounting and reporting responsibilities imposed by the Secretary of the Treasury (

) The accounting system of an executive agency or any of its component is subject to review and approval by the Comptroller General. The continuing efforts to improve, modernize, and simplify accounting systems in the Government are exercised under a “Joint Program” sponsored by the Comp- troller General, the Secretary of the Treasury, and the Director of the Bureau the Budget. a. This program contemplates the full development of sound accounting within each executive agency, as a working arm of management, and in terms of ﬁnancial information and control. It envisions an integrated pattern of accounting and ﬁnancial reporting, for the Government as a whole, that will be responsive to executive and legislative needs. b. The established accounting and reporting principles, standards, and procedures will take into consideration the various areas of involved, the elimination of overlapping operations and paper work, and the fuller application of efficient methods and techniques in accounting erations throughout the Government. c. Integration of revenue accounting data with central accounts maintained by the Treasury, Bureau of Fiscal Services is accomplished primarily by the submission of monthly SF
, Statement of Transactions, reporting deposits, classiﬁed collections, and disbursements. (
) Service officials and managers must communicate security standards contained in IRM

, Basic Security Concepts, to subordinate and establish methods to enforce them. Employees are responsible for required precautions in providing security for the documents, information, property which they handle in performing official duties. (
) Security safeguards, adequate security equipment containers, and facilities must be provided for the safeguarding of all protectable items per in IRM
, Basic Security Concepts . (

) The Enterprise Computing Center (ECC) is primarily responsible for mainte- nance of the Master File Record for each taxpayer and for the electronic Computing processing of inputs and outputs related to the Master File records. (ECC) a. ECC will maintain accounting and control data for BMF and IMF, records through systemically posted Master File control records. The manual creation of Control Registers is optional (not required) as the count from the Auto Control Records will be the systemic point of validation for run balancing. There are no Master File processes dependent upon the manual preparation or balancing of the control register. All ﬁnancial data for Master Files will be maintained in the Redesigned Revenue Control System (RRACS). RRACS balancing will be performed by the Submission Processing Campuses. Note: Control Registers may be prepared if deemed necessary by Infor- mation Technology EOPS PVS management in support of unique processing periods such as start up or special circumstances as conversion or transition processing. b. ECC will maintain a Reciprocal Accounting Control Records (RACR) for each Submission Processing Campus. An IMF RACR will be created as well as weekly in the CADE
environment. (See Exhibit

) c. During Master File posting operations at ECC, various ﬁles of transactions, adjustments, refund data, and abstracts of revenue will be generated. These output ﬁles are transmitted to the appropriate Submission Processing Campuses for printing and for post-journalization through RRACS. (

) PVS will electronically certify refund schedules, for IMF and BMF, for each Submission Processing Campus. The schedules cover the total count and amount of overpayment, principal, and interest for IMF and BMF refund data. a. An Authorized Certifying Officer of ECC will certify each voucher for the account of the applicable Submission Processing Campus Director. b. The electronically certiﬁed vouchers and the refund media will be ted to the Kansas City Financial Center for issuance of the refund and direct deposit. (See IRM
, Bureau of Fiscal Services Secure Payment System) (

Compiling processing notes using COHs, transmittal notes when (SCIPAS) are made, and e-mail from programmers, and post to the shared drive c. Build reject ﬁles based on transmittals received from program areas d. Resolving ﬂags issued by SCIPAS e. Release refund ﬁles for transmission to BFS (

) The Processing Validation Section (PVS) coordinates with Submission Pro- cessing Campuses regarding reciprocal Master File accounts and balances, advises on adjustments, balances and certiﬁes refunds, applies control systems to assess the validity and propriety of operational processes and to detect data or systemic irregularities, initiates investigative and diagnostic action to resolve problems, reports on accountability impact and maintains audit trails when it is necessary to manually create the audit trail, analysis of error-ﬁle data, provides adjustments (DAV’s) to the Submission cessing Campuses and validates quantitative and monetary controls for all Master File production processing when manual processes are required. (

) PVS is responsible for the following: a. Refund validation and certiﬁcation (Interface – IBM Master File and Priority b. Documentation of all activities in the remarks section of the to explain out of balances and actions taken to resolve d. Validation of all Master File output (Interface – IBM Scheduling, CSA Programmers) Note: “v” to validate jobs – looking for indication of an unresolved error the control list (out of balance indicated to the right of each job) e. Validate daily Revenue Receipt output controls (Interface - IBM Master and Submission Processing Campus Accounting and Unisys Mainline) f. Veriﬁcation of RACR summary report submitted by Submission Campus Accounting g. Supporting Tasks • Review and analysis of CLIST • Validation of errors within Master File output controls • Conﬁrmation all out of balance Joblog Validation listings are resolved and require no further action by PVS.
